noun.description: The action of using someone or something as a model.
examples: a child learns to speak by imitation

noun.description: A thing intended to simulate or copy something else.

phrases: Sure, imitation is the sincerest form of flattery - unless the imitator, dressed in sequins and feathers, belts out mutated lyrics to songs you made famous.
Like I said, I've been trying not to completely copy from her, but as they say, imitation is the sincerest form of flattery.
However, imitation is the sincerest form of flattery; when I met the director he said do you mind if I call you God?
Nor does he now think that imitation is the sincerest form of flattery.
Sure, imitation is the sincerest form of flattery.
origin: Late Middle English: from Latin imitatio(n-), from the verb imitari (see imitate).
